intro: Dinoseris salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaved dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of willow-like leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, disturbed habitats. Dinoseris salicifolia is a hardy perennial that is relatively easy to grow in gardens with well-drained soil.
